title: Lovegood Performing Arts Company
description:
Lovegood Performing Arts Company opened its doors for in-person and virtual classes in February of 2021, serving students ages 8-22 with dance, voice, acting, and technical theater education and performance opportunities. 

For students 10 to 22 years of age, Lovegood provides an opportunity to dive deep into four main focus areas: dance, voice, acting, and technical theater.  Many students take more than one focus area during a season, allowing them to engage in multiple areas of interest simultaneously.  The intention with classes based on focus areas is to allow for deep instruction and progression within the area or areas students want to explore most.

For 8 and 9 year old students Lovegood offers a weekly musical theater combination class that introduces their youngest students to dance, voice, and acting all in one class session.

Lovegood is unique in their approach to involving students in all aspects of the performing arts experience. In addition to on-stage performance opportunities youth participants in the technical theater program are working with adult instructors to learn the art of technical theater. They are working to build an all new black box studio, which is giving them hands-on experience with how a theater is put together. Lovegood is the only youth performing arts company in Beaverton with a professional black box studio venue as part of their educational space; which provides a unique opportunity for students to perform in the same place they attend classes and rehearse.

title: Balance Soccer Summer Camps
description:
The most FUN, OVERNIGHT soccer camps ever!  Bunk with your friends and teammates after a long day of nonstop FUN!

Camps are uniquely designed to develop soccer skills, encourage personal responsibility and improve self awareness. Balance Soccer Founder and Camp Director, Tyler Pagano will be there to guide parents and campers through it all.

Boys Camp June 23-27 / Girls Camp July 13-17

Camps are for all skill levels.  Ages 9-16.  Join us for our 5 year anniversary!

300 foot Slip n Slide
Grass Soccer Field
Heated Outdoor Swimming Pool
Lazy River Float
Tons of Basketball Courts
THE MOST Creative Soccer Games and Competitions
Additional Training Options for Competitive Campers
NCAA Soccer Playing Counselors

title: Adventure Camp
description:
Adventure Camp is an all-day summer camp for kids in Kindergarten - 5th Grade. Each of our 9 themed weeks include field trips to top Portland locations, art & cooking projects, water slides, outdoor games on our 26 acre campus, and much more! Register now to save a spot for the adventures ahead - sibling discounts are available!

Lunches, before care, and after care are also available. Adventure Camp is a program by Southwest Bible Church.

Click the links below for more information:

Register Here

Schedule & Pricing

Our Mission

FAQ’s

Photo Highlights

Contact Us

title: North Clackamas Parks & Recreation Department
address: 5440 Southeast Kellogg Creek Drive, Milwaukie, OR, USA
description: NCPRD offers a wide variety of affordable day camps to keep kids of all ages active and having fun all summer long. Choose from science, nature, dance, horseback riding, theater, science, track and field, lacrosse, tennis, pull-the-flag football and more. Full day camps and disability-inclusive options are available. See the full schedule at ncprd.com/summer-camps. Registration opens April 12.

title: Dance with The Portland Ballet
description:
The Portland Ballet, a world-class dance academy, trains students ages 3-22 in a professional curriculum guided by resident teachers and guest masters with expertise in both the classical and contemporary repertoire. With its nurturing, student-centered training, TPB welcomes all identities and helps to build confidence, maturity, and discipline. Graduates have carried TPB’s reputation for excellence into major professional companies and conservatory programs throughout the U.S. and abroad.

Performance opportunities for all ages include dancing in annual shows Thanksgiving weekend and in the spring.

PROGRAMS

-Curriculum (ages 6-18): Classes September-June provide dancers with a strong technical foundation as they progress from beginning Level 1 to advanced Level 7.

-Creative Ballet (ages 3-6): Little ones explore dance in a fun, guided way that is safe and non-competitive while they develop motor skills, strength, balance, and flexibility. 

-Free Classes (ages 6-9): A commitment-free three-class series, offered twice a year in August and January, is a great way for children to see whether ballet is right for them.

-Men’s Program (ages 6-22): Taught by men for men, classes focus on the needs and skills specific to young male dancers, who develop strength, poise, and discipline.

-Hip Hop and Body Control: This free weekly class is especially geared to male dancers.

-Career Track (ages 14-22): This intense and personal learning environment offers well-trained, advanced dancers with professional intent a setting that simulates a professional company experience.

-Summer Programs: A variety of programs for ages 6-18 keep dancers in shape while they develop new skills.

-Ballroom Dancing: This special opportunity applies to advanced dancers.

title: Little Kitchen Academy Bridgeport Village
description:
Enjoy $50 toward a Fall Session!  Use code: HARVEST

Seasonal sessions run year-round and are organized by age group (ages 3-5, 6-8, 9-12, and 13+ years old). Students experience a 3-hour class once a week during the school year or over five consecutive days during Summer, Winter, & Spring breaks. In each class, students learn how to make healthy, delicious and seasonal meals from scratch to consumption — all while experimenting with math and science concepts, working on their reading skills, and polishing up their table manners by sharing meals around the LKA community table (made with more than 33,000 recycled chopsticks).

As warm summer days give way to the crisp, fresh air of Fall and the leaves change from green to gold, we know that the harvest season has begun. In Fall, Mother Nature provides us with delicious fresh vegetables like squash, pumpkins, corn, and carrots. This bounty of fresh, colorful vegetables inspires our students to try new foods that they never knew they liked!

Our Fall Season is a time of delight and exploration as our students try new recipes filled with fresh, local, seasonal vegetables. The weather may begin to get colder, but inside Little Kitchen Academy every day is full of warmth and joy as your child learns practical life skills that will last a lifetime.

title: Topaz Farm on Sauvie Island
description:
Topaz Farm is a family farm for all families! We're first-generation farmers, but our three-generation family operates the 130 acre, no-spray and regenerative farm with lots of activities for kids and families including:

Dozens of animals including mini-donkeys, mini-goats, pigs, runner ducks and more.
U-pick berries and u-cut flowers
The island's first and only sunflower festival and maze
Farm to Plate picnics
Harvest festivals featuring live music
The island's largest farm stand, featuring house-made kid (and adult!) food, drinks and snacks
An outdoor bar and grill
Fall harvest activities including a huge corn maze, hay rides and pumpkin patches

With our on-site parter, the non-profit Sauvie Island Center, we're able to host summer and school break camps, workshops and volunteer days for kids and adults throughout the year.

Many of our special events are by pre-order or reservation-only, so be sure to sign up for our email newsletter on our website or follow us on social media for all the latest announcements.

title: Portland City United (PCU)
description:
June Skills Camp (Mon. June 13th- Thurs. June 16th, 2022)
9:00am-12:00pm | $135 per player | Register​
Open to all players of all experience and ability levels, born 2008-2015.
This summer day camp is more soccer focused than a typical summer camp and will be structured like a fun training session. There will be an emphasis on improving campers' technical skills and enhancing their in-game decision making. Campers should want to improve, compete and have fun!
Location: Buckman Field Park | Registration Deadline: Friday, June 10th
Organized by Portland City United Soccer Club 

 

June Summer Camp (Mon. June 20th- Thurs. June 23rd, 2022)
9:00am-2:00pm | $155 per player | Register
​Open to all players of all experience and ability levels, born 2008-2015.
This camp is a soccer based camp but focused on fun! There will be soccer based activities along with classic summer camp games, coloring, water fights on hot days and more!
Location: Buckman Field Park | Registration Deadline: Friday, June 17th
Organized by Portland City United Soccer Club 

 

July Summer Camp (Mon. July 18th- Thurs. July 21st, 2022)
9:00am-2:00pm | $155 per player | Register
​Open to all players of all experience and ability levels, born 2008-2015.
This camp is a soccer based camp but focused on fun! There will be soccer based activities along with classic summer camp games, coloring, water fights on hot days and more!
Location: Buckman Field Park | Registration Deadline: Friday, July 15th
Organized by Portland City United Soccer Club 
July Skills Camp (Mon. July 25th- Thurs. July 28th, 2022)
9:00am-12:00pm | $135 per player
Open to all players of all experience and ability levels, born 2008-2015.
This summer day camp is more soccer focused than a typical summer camp and will be structured like a fun training session. There will be an emphasis on improving campers' technical skills and enhancing their in-game decision making. Campers should want to improve, compete and have fun!
Location: Buckman Field Park | Registration Deadline: Friday, July 22nd
Organized by Portland City United Soccer Club

title: Cognizart by MetroArts Inc. 360 Arts Camp
address: 4033 Southwest Canyon Road, Portland, OR, USA
description:
Three weeks only!
Week 1, July 11-15, 2022
Week 2, July 18-22, 2022
Week 3, July 25-29, 2022

Igniting Creativity, Fun & Friendship
Newmark Theatre, 1111 SW Broadway
World Forestry Center, 4033 SW Canyon
9 a.m. to 4 p.m.
​
About 360 Arts Camp
​Since 1993, Cognizart by MetroArts Inc. Kids camp has given kids ages 6 1/2-12 a chance to be immersed in visual arts, music, theater, and dance Monday through Friday. This is 360 Arts Education!

All campers must follow instructions, participate, collaborate with others, read and write, and be respectful self-managers. The overall lesson plans and daily goals for creation for both age groups are similar, with age-appropriate challenge-level to keep the artistic spark alive.

Campers ages 6 1/2 to 9
Lesson plans for younger campers focus on encouraging natural creativity, fearlessness, and gifts. Younger campers are often paired with Intern helpers who can help to ignite confidence and assist with reading or writing. However, our ability to provide "hands-on" assistance is limited.

Campers ages 10 to 12
Lesson plans for older campers allow for the opportunity to explore and collaborate with peers. Older campers create more complex artistic projects, try new things, and showcase their unique talents and gifts.

​Friday Artists
On Friday of each camp, we work with artists from diverse cultural and ethnic backgrounds to perform and workshop with our campers.
Previous Friday Artists include Journey Brazil, En Taiko, Natya Leela Academy, Inka Jam, and Grupo Condor.
The incredible 2022 Friday Artists Are
Latin Groove PDX Productions
Mic Crenshaw Performs Social Justice Hip Hop​

The Venues
Week 1 - Newmark Theatre, 1111 SW Broadway
We're returning to our home for the first week of 360 Arts Camp in 2022. We will be utilizing the Winningstad & Brunish Theatres. as well as lobby space. It's a very cool location.

Weeks 2 & 3 - World Forestry Center Central Plaza & Cheatham Hall
4033 SW Canyon Road, Portland, OR 97221. It's an immersive and vibrant distinctly Oregon location nestled in the trees.
We selected the World Forestry Center because of its convenient location off Highway 26, across the zoo's parking lot, and a few steps from the Max station. We strongly encourage taking public transportation.

360 Arts Camp will be located at the tented outdoor Central Plaza to the left of the Discovery Center and in Cheatham Hall, which offers ample space for socially distancing and creation. Campers will be indoors and outdoors throughout the day and provided with outdoor mask breaks. Campers will be in age-based pods. We may also take field trips to explore the Japanese Garden, Children's Museum, zoo, and surrounding trails.

Access to the Arts - Scholarships Available!
We believe in the vital importance of arts education in self-confidence, wellbeing, and social inclusion. Therefore, we offer scholarships for children to attend 360 Arts Camp. Scholarships, generally 20-90%, are needs-based and awarded on camper loads and will be reviewed and awarded monthly until we reach capacity.

​What happens at 360 Arts Camp?
Campers arrive between 8:50 a.m. and 9 a.m., participate in fun warm-up exercises, and receive the schedule for the day. Monday through Thursday, campers create art in two disciplines (visual arts and music, for instance) in the morning and two in the afternoon (theater and dance, for example). The order of the disciplines alternates each day.
On Fridays, campers utilize the skills and creations throughout the week to create a group performance, incorporating lessons learned from our multicultural guest artists. Therefore, attendance each day is important.
Camp ends at 3:58 p.m. with a prompt pickup at 4 p.m.

​The Faculty
Each of our faculty members is a trained artist and educator in their respective visual arts, music, theater, and dance disciplines. Many will be returning to our camp, having been a part of it for years.

​The Counselors (formerly known as Interns!) - Kids Ages 13-18
We have opportunities for older kids who would like to participate and earn valuable volunteer experience. These incredible teenagers, who proudly wear green t-shirts, are usually former campers. They have the opportunity to supervise, create art, and work directly to inspire younger kids.

title: School of Send, Mountain Bike Camps
address: Post Canyon Drive, Hood River, OR, USA
description: School of Send offers kids mountain bike camps in Hood River, OR. We aim to create a community of like-minded riders that build mountain biking skills in a progressive, comfortable, and positive environment. All coaches are professionally certified through PMBIA and our 6:1 rider to coach ratio ensures that all riders progress safely. With after school, weekend, and summer options for kids ages 3+, we sure to have something for everyone.

title: Oregon 4-H Summer Camps
address: 5390 4 H Rd NW, Salem, OR, USA
description:
Every kid deserves a classic 4-H summer camp experience.

At 4-H Summer Camp the days are filled with fun, new friends and laughter. The nights are filled with campfires, songs, stars and happy dreams.

The Oregon 4-H Center is offering a variety of sessions of overnight camp for children in grades 4-8.  Youth do not have to be in 4-H to enroll.  Registration is open to youth from any Oregon county.  All lodging, meals and recreation are included in this five-day, four-night experience.  Contact the Camp Registrar for campership funds information.  The Oregon 4-H Center is located in the forested Eola Hills west of Salem, Oregon.

Activities include:

Archery – at the newly remodeled archery range
Pool time – cool off and play with friends
Giant Swings - a camper favorite
Arts & Crafts - for those creative kids
Canoeing - on scenic Pagoda Pond
Outdoor Science - for the explorer in all of us
And, of course, songs around the camp fire!

For more than 100 years, Oregon State University Extension 4-H camping has been a proven and effective method of teaching youth life skills and providing a safe, engaging and FUN learning experience that provides lifelong friendships and memories for a lifetime. 4-H camping teaches youth to make their own decisions, solve problems, and manage their resources by providing hands-on experiential learning. Through involvement in the 4-H camping program, youth gain a better appreciation of living as a community by learning how to become more responsible and think critically. Designed for the next generation of leaders, explorers, designers and innovators our 4-H camp helps build skills for life.

Dates and Rates for 2022:

Four Rivers 4-H Camp - June 28 – July 2, 2022 -$515

Wild West One 4-H Camp - July 12 -16, 2022 - $525

Wildlife Stewards 4-H Camp - July 26 – July 30, 2022 - $556

Wild West Two 4-H Camp - August 16 – August 20, 2022 - $525

Register now at   https://extension.oregonstate.edu/4h/4-h-center-camps

address: 5440 Southeast Kellogg Creek Drive, Milwaukie, OR, USA

title: In a Child’s Path Farm Preschool
description:
In a Child’s Path Farm Preschool, located on an eight-acre farm in Clackamas County just 10 minutes east of Gresham, is a child-centered program promoting all facets of development in children ages 2 to 5 years. Children learn how to care for animals, plant gardens, cook and enjoy music time. Please call Cindy at 503.912.0035 or email to schedule a tour. We also offer week-long summer camps for children 3-6 years old. Please visit our summer camps webpage for more information.

We are now offering summer camps to children aged 3 to 6 this summer with a main focus on the farm and a variety of minor focuses each week. The camps are structured in a way that the learning ties together. For example, if a child attends camp for three consecutive weeks, the learning will not seem staggered; it will flow respectfully in a way that a child will learn best. On the other hand, if a child attends only one week or a week each month their learning will flow nicely as well. We will meet at camp starting each new week with a song that is relevant to our subject of learning along with open-ended activities at different stations. The yard that the campers work in when they arrive each morning is comprised of six flower beds, a jungle gym, a large sandbox, a playhouse, a rock wall, and tons of room to run! After breakfast, we could be found anywhere on the eight acres.

title: Camp Wa-Ri-Ki
address: 17051 Washougal River Road, Washougal, WA, USA
description:
Fun! That’s what is waiting for campers of all ages this year at Camp Wa-Ri-Ki!

Kiwanis Camp Wa-Ri-Ki, located in Washougal, Skamania County, Washington is 18+ acres of beautiful land in the heart of the Gifford Pinchot National Forest. It is our mission to provide an outdoor experience that offers optimal development of at-risk youth and our communities through recreational, educational and leadership opportunities. We offer programs in four categories: Nature-based Learning; Leadership and Personal Development; Fun, Exploration and Adventure and Outdoor Skills. Many camp activities integrate with local school’s STEM and STEAM curriculum.

NASA’s GLOBE Goes to Camp

Our programs are available by age group to allow peer-learning, appropriate outcome measures and to ensure safety of participants. We are the ONLY camp in Washington State that is a certified partner with NASA’s GLOBE Goes to Camp pilot program. GLOBE: Global Learning and Observations to Benefit the Environment provides exciting learning opportunities through hands-on experiences.

Station Master Training

Designed for campers 15 year and up – including adults – this training program offers a unique opportunity to learn and lead. Campers learn the basics of the GLOBE program while becoming a “master” at leading activities in four core areas: Atmosphere; Biosphere; Hydrosphere and Pedosphere (Soil). This training is FREE and is offered through a virtual platform.

Ladybug Garden

Our Ladybug Garden program offers a variety of connections to the garden. From gardening basics for elementary campers to upper grade level campers that utilize the garden in their GLOBE experiments.

Nature Days

One of our most popular programs, Nature Days is designed for our youngest campers to explore the living world around them. From leaf’s to bugs, from water to sky, campers have a great time playing games, running through the meadow to discover new and exciting elements of nature.

Volunteer Opportunities – Camp Counselor

In addition to our Station Master program, we offer volunteer opportunities to youth (15+) and adults to assist with activities during each camp session. Camp Counselors lead activities, monitor play to ensure safety and guide campers from one activity to another.

Internship Opportunities

For campers 15+ that want to spend more time at camp, we have a number of opportunities available to help explore career interests, expand skills, and develop work experiences. We work with each individual camper to design a program that meets their needs and career/work goals.

More Information

More program details, registration and date information can be found on our website at www.campwariki.com. You can also read our “Safety First” COVID-19 plan to keep everyone safe while at camp.

title: Oregon Gymnastics Academy
description: OGA provides a top quality gymnastics education to children of all ages and abilities. We strive to develop high caliber athletes with strong character who are able to be successful and progress in the sport to the highest level they desire. Through the sport of gymnastics, OGA teaches life lessons and skills our athletes will take with them and utilize to have a positive impact on the world.

title: Summer at OES
address: 6300 Southwest Nicol Road, Portland, OR, USA
description: In-person camps for ages 4-17. STEAM Crafting, Skateboarding Camp, Welcome to Audio Blast, Columbia River Gorge Wonders and more. Visit www.oes.edu/summer.

title: River Ranch Summer Equestrian Day Camp
description: River Ranch is offering Summer Day Camps in 2022 tailor made to your child’s needs. Day Horse Camps and Half Day Pony Camp sessions will be available Monday -Friday from June through August. Camp curriculum will include learning to care for, lead, groom and tack your horse, riding instruction in flatwork and equitation, riding demonstrations, as well as information given on horse care, riding theory and safety techniques. Horses, Ponys and equipment are provided by River Ranch. Our groups are very small, only 7-8 kids per week with all campers enjoying the responsibility of caring for and learning to love a horse or pony for the week.

title: Evergreen Aviation & Space Museum Aerospace Camps
address: 500 NE Capt. Michael King Smith Way
description:
The best aerospace camps in the Pacific Northwest are back!

Our interactive one-week programs are filled with exciting, educational experiences designed to engage 3rd – 9th graders.

Evergreen Aviation & Space Museum aerospace camps will ignite a passion for exploration, innovation, and STEAM in future aviators and space explorers.

title: Anthony Newman Sports Camps at Catlin Gabel School Summer 2022!
address: 8825 Southwest Barnes Road, Portland, OR, USA
description: Anthony Newman’s Sports Camps offers our Multi-Sport Camp for young athletes who are not quite ready to focus on just one sport. A great introduction to the sports world whether you are experienced or new to sports, this camp will offer opportunities to experience all types of sports both conventional and non-conventional, i.e. basketball, soccer, football, softball, P.E. activities, games, coordination, agility and so much more! Anthony Newman’s Sports Camps is a great opportunity for children to discover the thrill of sports while making new friends.

title: Experiment PDX Summer Camps
address: Experiment PDX, Southeast Stark Street, Portland, OR, USA
description:
Experiment PDX is SE Portland's newest venue for all things STEAM! This summer, we'll be hosting summer camps in partnership with local educators, artists, the PDX Insectarium, and Mad Science! Camps range from grades K-8 with something for every kiddo and feature both half-day and full-day camps.  Week-long camps start on July 5th and run through the end of August!

Experiment PDX Summer Camp Registration Raffle

Every time you complete a camp registration, you’ll be entered into our raffle for a chance to win two free workshop tickets (any age) or a free birthday party for up to 10 children! (valid at Experiment PDX or the Portland Insectarium)

Camp Contact Info: Molly Radany | curious@experimentpdx.com

Lego Learning Camp

Classic LEGO construction meets modern learning! Explore engineering, basic coding, and build creativity through LEGOs and Intelligent Hardware. Creative tech and hands-on projects will excite your child and expand their teamwork skills!

Junior Da Vinci Art Camp

Students will experience hands-on art history, work with various materials and traditional techniques, and learn about spacial skills through geometry, perspective, shading, and texture. All camps are tailored to age level and materials are provided - includes a personal sketchbook and a take-home final project masterpiece!

Curious Colors - Science, Art, and Light Camp

Prisms, paints, lasers & illusions - experiment, play, and create! Explore the spectrum of light, learn principles of color and rainbows. Create natural dyes, learn painting techniques, and experience illusions that will inspire your junior scientist’s curiosity!

Mad Science of PDX and Vancouver

Mad Science is partnering with Experiment PDX to offer a variety of STEAM summer camps. From chemistry and engineering to archaeology and inventions, find the perfect science experience for all young investigators!

Mad Science Junior Science Explorers 1 & 2

Decipher the world all around us - campers will develop their earth awareness and explore the world as junior naturalists before heading for space as junior astronauts. Campers will also explore just why their big toe is important and how to find their center of gravity as they investigate the science of space!

Mad Science Moving with Science

Join the Mad Scientist in a fun-filled exploration of how science keeps our world moving. Take a close-up look at a wide array of scientific disciplines including chemistry, biology, engineering, physics, and optics. Take apart owl pellets to see what they cannot digest! Join a team of camper engineers and build bridges, domes, cubes, and pyramids. Make your own sidewalk chalk, crystal garden, and a chromatography-dyed T-shirt!

Mad Science Creative Contraptions

Eureka! Creativity and Innovation abound! Junior inventors explore the real-life inventions of DaVinci, Edison, and the Wright Brothers to Isaac Asimov's dreams of future inventions. Each day campers are given a series of challenges that must be overcome using basic materials, simple machines, tips from famous inventors, and the most important thing of all - their minds. They'll construct catapults and forts, fabricate innovative flying contraptions, design their own gizmo prototypes and will assemble a glowing sword!

Mad Science Underground Explorers

Learn about archaeology and the techniques scientists use to excavate long-lost cities! Discover ancient civilizations and the tools and artifacts they use in everyday life! Study bone fragments, pottery shards, amber deposits, and fossils to understand what they can tell us about history. What's more, each class includes a make-and-take-home project like a fossil replication, an amber time capsule, and coins from around the world. 

Register your child for the summer of a life-time!  Two half-day camps can be paired which allows your child to experience art, science, and learning from 9am-4pm with a supervised lunch hour in between!

title: Ekone Summer Camps
description:
Since 1986, Ekone has been a home to children in the summertime.  At Ekone, campers experience being an important member of an inclusive community, in relationship and service to a place.  We believe that this experience is fundamental to our human nature, transformative for those who experience it, and essential to creating a viable, vibrant future on Earth. 

And fun!  If there's anything Ekone is known for, it's finding the fun in everything. 

Days at camp are spent almost entirely outside, with a community of 25-30 children aged 8-18, and a crew of 10-15 staff and mentors aged 16-80.  Together, we engage in play, work, skill-building, and activities designed to connect us to nature, each other, and ourselves.  We learn to listen closely to the birds.  We stalk the deer at the pond.  We create art from found objects.  We run wild through the woods.  We shed some of the busy-ness of modern life and remember how to make our own fun.

We also care for the needs of our place and community, taking responsibility for ourselves and our shared experience.  We cook meals, clean up after them, tend the garden, feed the animals, buck hay, haul firewood, and engage in conservation projects on the land.  We learn to listen to each other, speak our truth with kindness, and create the kind of community we want to live in.

And we simply enjoy life on the ranch.  Campers sleep in the rustic A-frame bunkhouse or under the stars.  Our wholesome, delicious meals are cooked from scratch, and most of our produce is from Ekone's own garden.  We take a break from screens, mirrors, makeup, competition, and drama.  We swim in the pond, swing on the rope swings, catch frogs, and build forts. 

​This year we will be providing both Family Camps and some overnight camps for teens. Family Camps will provide day-camp style activities during the day for kids, with shared family meals and plenty of time together as well.

title: The Hangout
address: 4707 SE Belmont St, Portland, OR, USA
description: Creative, safe, educational, after school care that your kids will LOVE. We designed The Hangout for you and your kids. We believe that kids should love their after school care and come home excited to talk to you about out all the things they have created and learned. At The Hangout we offer your child the freedom to make their own choices, explore new ideas, engage socially, and learn and grow! The Hangout is a space where kids ages 5-13 years-old can hangout, engage with friends, stimulate their minds with creative activities, and learn self-direction. More of a club than a program, at The Hangout we provide a wide variety of arts, crafts, games and technologies and then support our members as they follow their own interests.

title: BRAIN BALANCE OF OREGON
address: 18395 NW West Union Rd, Portland, OR, USA
description:
Unleash your child's potential with the leading drug-free program designed to enhance cognitive performance and emotional wellbeing.

The Brain Balance Program engages the brain and body in such a way that it improves the way the brain functions, leading to improvements in how we feel and function in our daily lives.  Our program is designed to help with the root cause of a variety of behavioral and developmental issues, including but not limited to: Anxiety, ADHD, Dyslexia, Oppositional Defiant Disorder (ODD), Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD).

A Harvard study found that 3-months of Brain Balance treatment was as effective as stimulant medication in alleviating ADHD symptoms in children. https://www.brainbalancecenters.com/brain-balance-program-research-and-results

We'd love to help you or somebody you know.  Mention PDX parent and qualify for a $49 assessment, a $200+ value!

title: Write Now Portland – Creative Writing and Nature Play Camp
address: Mt Tabor Park, Southeast Salmon Street, Portland, OR, USA
description:
The Creative Writing and Nature Play Summer Camps are inspiring children to write again this summer. Children ages 8-12 will develop their own stories, play games and build a sense of community in these half-day outdoors writing camps. We focus on activating the five senses both in the writing and in the games we play, ensuring an exciting and experiential week for all.
 
One of our favorite quotes about this camp came from a 4th grade boy who said last summer, "I woke up with a smile on my face every day just knowing that I got to come to this camp."
 
Your child will develop writing skills, get exercise and have a great time expanding their creativity.
 
Often children want to do the camp multiple times, to keep working on their story and to enjoy time out in nature. This camp is open ended and can be repeated.
 
The schedule can be found here:  http://www.writenowportland.com/summer-camps.html

title: Soccer Shots
description:
PORTLAND'S PREMIER YOUTH SOCCER PROGRAM!

Soccer Shots Portland is an engaging children’s soccer program with a focus on character development. Our caring team positively impacts children’s lives on and off the field through best-in-class coaching, communication and curriculum. Our coaches are the best-trained in the business. Our expert-approved curriculum is age-appropriate and aligns with childhood education standards. In addition we provide an exceptional customer experience and ongoing communication with parents.

title: Code Ninjas Hillsboro
description:
UNLEASH YOUR CHILD'S INNER NINJA!


Does your child like video games? They will love Code Ninjas! Transform your child's love for technology into an exciting learning adventure.

CAMPS:
Our camps offer an immersive environment for kids 5-15 to explore and develop new skills, gain confidence, and have fun with friends. It's an unforgettable experience! 


SPRING BREAK CAMP: March 21-25th
Designing Modifications with Minecraft in the morning and Potential UNLOCKED: Become a Roblox Developer in the afternoon! Sign up for both and stay all day.

SUMMER CAMP: Weekly from June 20th to September 2nd
Click here to see our summer schedule.

Our camps include...
Kids 5-7:  JR Adventures in Game Design using Scratch, JR STEM Discoveries, and JR Inventors with Makey Makey.
Kids 8+*:  Modding with Minecraft, Moviemaking with Minecraft, Code Your Own Robot, Intro to Roblox Development, Become a YouTuber, Adventures in Game Design, Inventors with Makey Makey, and Stop Motion Animation.
Kids 10+*: Next Level Roblox Development and Program and Play in Python.
*Ages are recommendations, not requirements. Please call our center with questions.
Find camp descriptions here.

Sign up for an AM and PM camp to stay all day! 

CLASSES
Code Ninjas JR builds a foundation of coding and problem-solving skills for kids ages 5-7 through our fun and completely visual curriculum – no reading required! Our world-class program combines storytelling and game building with hands-on projects for an immersive education experience.

In Code Ninjas Create Program, kids have a blast building awesome video games and developing ninja coding skills on the path from white to black belt. Our fun program lets kids ages 8-14 learn to code year-round at their own pace! Drop-in at your convenience during weeknight and weekend hours.

PARENT'S NIGHT OUT
You deserve a night on the town. Meanwhile, your kids want to play and have fun. That's why we offer Parent's Night Out - a win-win evening for families. Drop off your kids at Code Ninjas, where they'll play games, eat pizza, and more! Once you've had a chance to unwind, swing by to pick them up (please) and hear about all the fun they've had!

Parent's Night Out is offered on the 2nd and 4th Friday of every month. Sign up today!
All kids 7-14 are welcome!

Code Ninjas Hillsboro
KIDS HAVE FUN, PARENTS SEE RESULTS®

title: Chapel Theatre Theatre Camps
address: 4107 Southeast Harrison Street, Milwaukie, OR, USA
description:
Chapel Theatre is a performing arts venue in Milwaukie, just a few minutes from Sellwood and Woodstock. We produce theatrical performances and offer space for others to do the same. This summer, we will offer a week long camp for youth ages 5-10 and teens age 11-17. Teens have the option to sign up for a 2-week camp, as well. Students will have an opportunity to learn from Chapel Theatre professionals in the areas of acting, movement theatre, dance, improv, and will end the week with a showcase of what they learned. Parents are invited to come and see their student perform on Friday of camp week.

Camps are half-day, grouped with students of a similar age. July 11-15 is for youth aged 5-10. August 1-5 and 8-12 are camps f0r teens aged 11-17. Camps are $180 for a week or $320 for 2 weeks. For more information on registration, visit our website here: https://chapeltheatremilwaukie.com/2022/01/10/2022-summer-camps/

title: The Hangout
address: 4707 SE Belmont St, Portland, OR, USA
description: Creative, safe, educational, after school care that your kids will LOVE. We designed The Hangout for you and your kids. We believe that kids should love their after school care and come home excited to talk to you about out all the things they have created and learned. At The Hangout we offer your child the freedom to make their own choices, explore new ideas, engage socially, and learn and grow! The Hangout is a space where kids ages 5-13 years-old can hangout, engage with friends, stimulate their minds with creative activities, and learn self-direction. More of a club than a program, at The Hangout we provide a wide variety of arts, crafts, games and technologies and then support our members as they follow their own interests.

title: Summer Sing
address: 11695 Southwest Park Way, Portland, OR 97225, USA
description:
Spend your summer singing with friends and keeping your music skills sharp. Through games and activities, movement, and rehearsal time, campers will learn to read and sing music all while having fun. Join us! Each Summer Sing camp culminates with a final performance and party for all participants and their families to showcase the creativity and music created during the week.

Meet Summer Sing's new camp director, Coty Raven Morris!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yq6XHEAUb5M

Financial Aid and Special Discounts Available!

Summer Sing is presented by the Oregon Repertory Singers Youth Choir (ORSYC) program directed by Aubrey Patterson. Make music a part of your child's life year-round. Learn More.

title: Friendly House Winter Camps
description:
2022 Winter Camp Enrolling Now!

Come for one day or for the entire break! Each day includes programming for grades K–5 from 7:30am to 6pm with engaging activities, creative play, and snacks. Pricing is by day, with a sliding scale to fit your family’s budget.

Visit our website to learn more. See below for a quick summary of our upcoming camps.

Week 1
Monday, December 19th—Arctic Expedition: Gym games and arctic animal crafts
Tuesday, December 20th—Winter Woodland: A nature scavenger walk and creative crafting
Wednesday, December 21st—Mythical Magic: Treasure hunt, crafts, and gym games
Thursday, December 22nd—A Fine Day for the Fine Arts: A trip to the Portland Art Museum
Friday, December 23rd—Swim Day: A trip to Mount Scott Community Pool
 
 
Week 2
Tuesday, December 27th—Whatcha Got Cookin’?: Cooking and baking
Wednesday, December 28th—Puppetry Day: Watch and create a puppet show
Thursday, December 29th—New Year’s Bash: Crafts, gym games, and a dance party
Friday, December 30th—Our Forest Home: A trip to the World Forestry Museum

title: Alpengirl Adventure Camp for Girls
description: Alpengirl is an overnight summer adventure camp for girls ages 11-16. Our 1 or 2 week outdoor camps are in the Pacific Northwest and Northern Rocky Mountains: Washington, Wyoming, Oregon, Idaho and Montana. We offer daily yoga, delicious camp food and tent camping combined with surfing, rafting, riding, climbing and more! ACA Accredited, small groups of 12 girls, 1:6 ratio. Cost: $1195-$3295 Ages Served: Ages 11 - 16 Dates: 16 different camps available, see website for specific dates.

description:

title: Willamette Sailing Club
address: 6336 S Beaver Ave, Portland, OR, USA
description:
Portland's center for small boat sailing since 1961, Willamette Sailing Club is located on the banks of the Willamette River, approximately 5 minutes south of downtown. The club hosts learn-to-sail summer camps, classes and race teams taught by certified instructors, with over 500+ students coming through our program annually! We offer classes for every age and level of experience. Whatever your sailing interest is, WSC provides the opportunity to get out on the river and enjoy some family fun in a safe, welcoming and scenic environment.

Students learn the basics of small boat sailing through hands on learning and fun games that are designed to practice boat handling and water safety. All classes are taught by US Sailing certified instructors and follow the US Sailing beginner curriculum. 50-foot swim check with a life jacket required.
